lead_paragraph: Mark Brooks fired an opening-round seven-under 65 to secure a one-shot lead over the defending champion, Jason Bohn, at the B.C. Open in Vernon, N.Y. Brooks, who claimed the last of his seven career titles at the 1996 P.G.A. Championship, mixed eight birdies with a single bogey. The tournament is being played at the Turning Stone Resort’s Atunyote Course, a late replacement for En-Joie Golf Club in Endicott, N.Y., which is unplayable after recent flooding.
